text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Zamboanga Peninsula |other_name = Region IX Western Mindanao (formerly) |settlement_type = Region |image_skyline = |image_alt = |image_caption = |image_flag = |flag_size = 120x80px |image_seal = |seal_size = 100x80px |image_map = |map_caption = Location in the Philippines |nickname = |motto = |coordinates = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Philippines |subdivision_type1 = Island group |subdivision_name1 = Mindanao |seat_type = Regional center |seat = Pagadian |largest_city = Zamboanga City |leader_title = |leader_name = |area_total_km2 = 17,056.73 |area_footnotes = |population_as_of = 2015 |population_total = 3,629,783 |population_footnotes = |population_density_km2 = auto |timezone = PST |utc_offset = +8 |iso_code = PH-09 |blank_name_sec1 = Provinces |blank_info_sec1 = |blank1_name_sec1 = Cities |blank1_info_sec1 = |blank2_name_sec1 = Municipalities |blank2_info_sec1 = 67 |blank3_name_sec1 = Barangays |blank3_info_sec1 = 1,904 |website = }} Zamboanga Peninsula is an administrative region in the Philippines. It is also known as Region IX. The regional center is Pagadian. The region has three provinces (Zamboanga del Norte, Zamboanga Sibugay and Zamboanga del Sur) and two cities (Isabela City and Zamboanga City). ==References== Category:Peninsulas of Asia
title: Zamboanga Peninsula
